result.name: family-resources-survey-main-dataset
result.notes: The Family Resources Survey collects information on the incomes and circumstances of private households in the United Kingdom. This survey is used for analysing the distribution of incomes, including the number of various household types in poverty. It has been running since October 1992. The published report summarises the results for the 2011/12 survey year in which approximately 20,000 households were interviewed. Anonymised UK Data Archive End User Licence.

organization.name: department-for-work-and-pensions
organization.title: Department for Work and Pensions
organization.description:
The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) is responsible for welfare and pension policy and is a key player in tackling child poverty. It is the biggest public service delivery department in the UK and serves over 20 million customers.

DWP is a ministerial department, supported by 13 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-work-pensions

result.title: Family Resources Survey Main Dataset
